subject: Personal Finance
title: Black Tuesday 1929
description: A short lesson to help you apply Black Tuesday 1929.

hook.text: On October 29, 1929, the stock market lost $14 billion in one day. Fortunes evaporated by lunchtime.

buildup.text: The Roaring Twenties brought massive speculation. People borrowed 90% of stock prices on margin.

discovery.text: When prices dipped, margin calls forced mass selling. Forced selling caused more dips. A death spiral.

twist.text: The crash wasn't the Depression itself. It was the spark. Bad policy responses turned a crash into a catastrophe.

climax.text: The Dow didn't recover to its 1929 peak until 1954 â€” twenty-five years of patient waiting.

punchline.text: One day can reshape an era.

quiz.question: What amplified the stock market crash of 1929?
options: Margin calls forcing mass selling in a downward spiral
